article_metadata.headline: Exclusive - United make decision on Amad's future
article_metadata.article_text:
Manchester United make decision on Amad's future - Manchester Evening News
===============

Manchester United make decision on Amad's future
================================================

Amad joined Man United from Atalanta in October 2020 but he has only played 10 times for the club.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By Samuel Luckhurst, Chief Manchester United writer

* 12:01, 17 JAN 2024
* Updated 12:03, 17 JAN 2024

Manchester United are planning to keep Amad beyond the closure of the January transfer window.

United expect Facundo Pellistri to join Granada on loan and believe Amad has an important role to play in the squad.

Amad, 21, made his first United appearance in more than two years as a substitute in the 2-1 defeat to Nottingham Forest on January 30.

The Ivory Coast international missed the FA Cup third round win against Wigan Athletic through illness and he could return to the squad for the fourth round tie at Newport County next week.

United signed Amad for £19million rising to £37m from Atalanta on transfer deadline day in October 2020 and the winger has played 10 times for the club.

Amad spent the second half of the 2021-22 season on loan at Rangers and shone during a season-long loan at Sunderland last term. Amad scored 14 goals in 42 games for the Championship side as Sunderland reached the play-offs.

Pellistri was due to leave on loan in the summer but ended up remaining at United after Amad sustained a knee injury in the pre-season win against Arsenal in July.

Amad returned to training in early December and he performed creditably off the bench in the loss at Forest.

article_metadata.headline: Ruben Amorim can unleash a Manchester United partnership Erik ten Hag only used once vs Ipswich
article_metadata.article_text:
Ruben Amorim can unleash a Manchester United partnership Erik ten Hag only used once vs Ipswich

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim has been given a much-needed boost ahead of his first game in charge on Sunday.

The sight of Kobbie Mainoo back on the grass at the Carrington earlier this week was exactly what Manchester United's supporters wanted to see ahead of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge this weekend.

The academy graduate has been missing for more than a month through injury, last featuring in United's 0-0 draw with Aston Villa at Villa Park on October 6.

Missing the last seven matches, the prospect of Mainoo being in contention for Amorim's debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town at Portman Road on Sunday afternoon will be a welcome boost for the new Reds head coach.

Next Tuesday will mark exactly a year to the day since Mainoo made his full Premier League debut for United, starring in their 3-0 win over Everton at Goodison Park. Deployed at the base of the midfield that afternoon, he produced an outstanding display.

From that moment onwards, Mainoo became a staple in United's midfield, starting 23 of the their remaining 25 Premier League matches last season. He had gone from being a promising academy product to a first-team undroppable in the blink of an eye.

Although Mainoo made his mark against Everton as a holding midfielder, it soon became apparent he was more comfortable getting on the ball and advancing. He is a forward-thinking player, capable of receiving the ball and looking to attack.

Amid Casemiro's downfall last season, United went into the summer transfer window knowing they had to recruit a world-class defensive-midfielder to sit alongside Mainoo in the engine room. After several months of speculation, Manuel Ugarte joined the club from Paris Saint-Germain on deadline day.

"Signing Manuel was another of our primary targets for this summer," said sporting director Dan Ashworth. "He is among the very best ball-winning midfield players in the world and has an excellent record at both club and international level.

"His qualities, experience and passion will be a great complement to our strong group of midfielders."

Signing a player of Ugarte's profile was exactly what both United and Mainoo needed. The Uruguayan was expected to slot straight into United's first-choice midfield and become Mainoo's perfect partner.

However, former United manager Erik ten Hag, who had made Ugarte his third-choice midfield signing during the summer, was not forthcoming when it came to giving the former Sporting Lisbon man an opportunity to make an early mark at Old Trafford. He featured just seven times under the Dutchman, making four starts.

Of those four starts, it was only on one of them that he lined up alongside Mainoo in midfield. They both started the 3-0 defeat to Tottenham Hotspur at Old Trafford on September 29, but Mainoo was substituted just before half-time with United both 1-0 down and a man down, following the sending off of Bruno Fernandes.

It was a forgettable afternoon, meaning it was hard to assess just how Ugarte and Mainoo could work in tandem.

Since their last and only start together, a lot has changed at Old Trafford, of course. Ten Hag has been sacked and replaced by Ruben Amorim, Mainoo has spent several weeks out injured and Ugarte has earned more minutes as a starter.

The 23-year-old worked with Amorim at Sporting prior to his move to PSG in July 2023 and has made more appearances under the new United boss than any other coach during his senior career, meaning he is highly likely to become an important figure in his plans at United.

Ugarte, under former United interim boss Ruud van Nistelrooy, formed a strong bond with Casemiro in midfield, but Mainoo's recent return to training means he could soon replace the Brazilian in the starting XI, forming Amorim's first-choice midfield next to Ugarte.

On paper, a midfield partnership of Ugarte and Mainoo offers a blend of defensive nous, ball retention and the opportunity to progress the ball. It is the midfield duo many United supporters anticipated becoming the club's first-choice partnership after Ugarte's August arrival.

The likelihood of Amorim installing a 3-4-3 formation means Fernandes, who previously operated as the most advanced midfielder in Ten Hag's preferred 4-3-3, is expected to be forced further forward, leaving two midfield spots up for grabs.

Ugarte is expected to bag one of them and Mainoo should claim the other once he is back up to full fitness, whether that be this weekend or a little further down the line. At the ages of 23 and 19, respectively, they should form United's midfield for the future.

His qualities, experience and passion will be a great complement to our strong group of midfielders.

article_metadata.headline: Ruben Amorim has already let true feelings known on two things at Man United after one week
article_metadata.article_text:
Ruben Amorim has been taking Manchester United training this week and has been left unimpressed by a number of things at the club, including the size of the squad.

Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim has reportedly already identified which players will fit into his desired style of play and those who won't.

Having arrived last week, Amorim has spent this week training with his squad at Carrington and getting a feel for the club ahead of his first game in charge at the weekend against Ipswich Town. The former Sporting Lisbon boss, who comes with a high reputation, has repeatedly urged his players to increase their pace throughout the week as he aims to make an immediate impact, with reports stating he has been taken aback by the lack of speed and intensity in training sessions.

Amorim plans to quickly implement his 3-4-3 system and it's understood that he already knows certain players won't be able to adapt to it, reports The Sun. His coaching staff and analysts are working hard to get the players up to speed with Amorim's set-up.

The 39-year-old's first game in charge will be against Ipswich Town on Sunday, where United are expected to showcase a new look under Amorim's guidance. Despite being surprised by certain aspects of training and some players, Amorim has also been impressed by the quality of others.

Despite currently sitting in the bottom half of the Premier League following their worst ever start to a season, Amorim believes this does not accurately reflect where the team should be.

Despite the significant investment in the squad, United are still not ready to compete for the title. Amorim has reportedly been forthright in his critique of the team's performance, which he believes has been subpar for over a decade.

He has apparently told his players that they have been 'living in Sir Alex Ferguson's shadow', unable to emulate his success. The last Premier League title was won under Ferguson in 2013, and Amorim feels that the team has failed to harness his spirit as a motivating force.

A source told The Sun: 'He told them that top managers have not replicated Sir Alex's success because they have lived in his shadow, rather than getting their team to play with his spirit.'

article_metadata.headline: Man United target Viktor Gyokeres teases transfer in Ruben Amorim message
article_metadata.article_text:
Viktor Gyokeres has hinted at a potential exit from Sporting Clube de Portugal at the end of this season. The Swedish striker has become one of Europe's most coveted talents following his stellar performances with the Portuguese champions, netting 23 club goals in just 16 matches this season.

Despite having a £83.5million (€100m) release clause in his contract, it is believed that Sporting president Frederico Varandas would entertain offers around £66m (€80m), provided Gyokeres remains with Sporting until the season concludes. This development is likely to pique the interest of some of Europe's top clubs and could spark a fierce battle for his signature next summer.

Following Manchester United's recent appointment of Gyokeres' former Sporting boss Ruben Amorim, they are considered one of the favourites to secure Gyokeres. Amorim and Gyokeres shared a strong bond during their time together in Lisbon.

Given United's current struggles for goals in the Premier League this season, they are in desperate need of a world-class finisher. Amorim, who will spend his initial six months at United assessing the squad, was informed when he left the Portuguese club last week that he wouldn't be permitted to approach them in the January transfer window and would have to wait until the summer.

Amorim will also benefit from the substantial financial backing of United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe. Gyokeres was asked about a potential move. He said: "These are rumours, nothing concrete. Of course I want to finish the season at Sporting, I enjoy my time there. I don't feel stressed about making a change in the future."

The prolific Sweden international then teased that a move away from Sporting could happen, adding: "We'll see when the time comes."

When commenting on Amorim's switch to United, Gyokeres did not hide his emotions, stating: "It's very sad that he left, but of course we understand the decision."

article_metadata.headline: I couldn't believe what Man United demanded after I joined - two stars showed how it's done
article_metadata.article_text:
Former Manchester United defender Matteo Darmian has explained the 'completely different world' he was opened up to when he joined the club in July 2015.

Darmian was brought to Old Trafford by Louis van Gaal and spent four years at the club racking up 92 appearances in the process. He would leave permanently in September 2019 to join Parma before eventually arriving at Inter where he remains to this day.

While his time at United is seen as largely forgettable, despite winning the Europa League, FA Cup and League Cup at Old Trafford, Darmian has now admitted that his spell in the Premier League opened him up to a new aspect of football. "When I signed for Manchester United, I discovered that in England, during away games, family members don’t have a reserved section; they sit among the fans," he told Cronache di Spogliatoio.

"The first match was the derby against Liverpool. I told my girlfriend: ‘Look, it’s a very intense match. Do you still want to come?’

"And she said: ‘Yes, of course, I really care.’ So, she got in the car with the steering wheel on the right and went into the away section.

"For a footballer, the English football culture brings less pressure. During the week, there’s less talk about football; the weekend and the experience of going to the stadium are more important."

While this was a culture shock, it was a mere footnote compared to the off-field duties that were expected of him - with the defender revealing the club demanding he open an Instagram account shortly after his arrival. "As soon as I arrived in Manchester, I discovered a completely new world," he added.

"In Italy, very few players had social media profiles. In England, on my first day, they immediately told me to open an Instagram account and that I would need to participate in commercial initiatives.

"What now seems normal wasn’t back then. There were so many commercial activities; it was a completely different world from what I was used to.

"In the following years, [Paul] Pogba and [Zlatan] Ibrahimovic also arrived, and they were media superstars."

article_metadata.headline: Ruben Amorim guarantee could give Manchester United fans what they have been crying out for
article_metadata.article_text:
Ruben Amorim guarantee could give Manchester United fans what they have been crying out for - Tyrone Marshall - Manchester Evening News
Ruben Amorim has started preparations for his first game as Man Utd head coach and has told fans what to expect at Portman Road.

Ruben Amorim has told United fans they quickly see his "idea" bought to life on the pitch.

In his first interview as Manchester United's head coach, Ruben Amorim kept returning to a couple of buzzwords that could define his early weeks at Old Trafford.

During his chat with club media, he referred to his "idea" five times and discussed his team's "identity" six times. This was very clearly sending a message. There were no promises of results, but there was a guarantee that supporters would see a plan very quickly.

"I think you will see an idea. You could like it or not, I don't know, but you will see an idea. You will see a positioning. You will see something," Amorim said of the first impression his team will deliver.

"Something that we want to reach that kind of level. You will feel that. But we have to know that it's like two training \[sessions\] before the first match. This is the best league in the world. But if I have to say something to you, you will see an idea. This I can guarantee."

That alone will be music to the ears of United fans who became fed up watching a team without an identity. Erik ten Hag might have delivered two trophies to Old Trafford, but there was never a sense that he was building a side with a clear style of play.

They became a moments team, individuals producing a brilliant piece of play to create or score a goal and win a game. From the beginning of last season, very few 90-minute performances suggested a clear tactical plan being implemented by the whole team. United were too open, too easy to play against, and too vulnerable to teams set up creatively with a clear plan.

Amorim clearly intends to change that. When Ten Hag held his first press conference, he said the players available to him would generally dictate the style of play. The new head coach intends to stick with his philosophy and his 3-4-3, with the players moulded to fit into that structure.

In some ways, the excitement around Amorim's first game at United is similar to that which greeted Jurgen Klopp's first as Liverpool boss. Again, the anticipation levels rose across an international break. Klopp sent out a team that pressed in a manner they hadn't done previously, and although the goalless draw at Tottenham was low on quality, it was a team that suggested he had a plan and would stick to it.

United fans will be tuning in at Portman Road, expecting to see something similar. Amorim's teams are built on different principles, but pressing will be critical, as will the role and energy of his wing-backs. Who is picked to play in what position will also be fascinating.

Two training sessions with his entire squad won't be enough for Amorim to instil all of his ideas. Having taken over at the start of the busiest stretch of the season, it could be months before he looks at his team and believes they have definitely got it.

But if supporters can look at the side that plays Ipswich this weekend, then Bodo Glimt and Everton at Old Trafford, and see the outline of a plan and identity coming together, then they will be happy. It's been too long since a United team was clearly identifiable by its patterns of play and its philosophy on the pitch.

article_metadata.headline: £20m concern, Amorim factor, ex-Wolves man impact - Alvaro Fernandez Man United transfer truth
article_metadata.article_text:
But the long term reliability of United's two recognised left-backs has been called into question given they have had to operate without either player since February. As such, there is talk United could look to strengthen their options in that department and Benfica's Alvaro Fernandez Carreras has emerged as an option to return to the club.

The Spanish defender left Old Trafford to join the Portuguese giants for £6million in the summer and has quickly established himself as an important player at the Estadio Da Luz, despite some initial suspicion.

"With a mixture of cautious optimism and suspicion," Alfredo Fumacas of the Benfica Podcast told the Manchester Evening News when asked about the initial reception around Benfica when they signed the Spanish under-21 international.

"Alejandro Grimaldo who joined Benfica midseason during the 2015/16 season provided consistency to a position which, up until that point, was a bit of a revolving door between inconsistency and players who just weren't at the level required.

"Grimaldo was able to secure the starting spot, and remained a staple of championship Benfica teams for seven-and-a-half seasons. Following Grimaldo's departure toBayer Leverkusen, Benfica was again faced with the lack of quality at the left back position.

"When Carreras joined half way through the 2023/24 season there were a lot of questions in terms of his worth. Was he going to be more cannon fodder, like David Jurasek, and Mihailo Ristic before him?

"There was the connection to Man United, but the successive loan spells at Preston and Granada, left Benfica fans suspicious of his worth, but cautiously optimistic at the same time.

"Carreras has had an impressive ascent this season, and part of it has been due to [former Wolverhampton Wanderers manager] Bruno Lage's arrival after the sacking of Roger Schmidt. Lage's tactics and game idea suits Carreras' abilities.

"He has not only evolved under Lage, but he has also grown extremely confident with mounting good performances this early in the season. Lately he is being looked at as a proper Grimaldo replacement, and has made many of the fans forget the Leverkusen full-back."

Fernandez has featured in all 16 of Benfica's matches this season across the Primeira Liga, Champions League, Taca da Liga and Taca de Portugal and has gone from strength to strength. He was unable to force his way into United's plans during his time in Manchester but has quickly grown into an important player in Lisbon and he is already attracting transfer attention from a number of big European clubs.

United inserted a €20million buyback clause into the deal to sell him and despite only leaving the club a matter of months ago, there is already concern in the Portuguese capital that he may return to Old Trafford.

"Of course there's concern from Benfica," Fumacas explained. "Benfica initially brought in Carreras on a loan, but activated the buy clause of €6m in the beginning of the season, knowing that there was a buy back clause of €20m, at the time there were some questions from the fans in terms of his worth.

"I don't believe Benfica expected Carreras to rise up this quickly and to be on the radar of many European clubs, usually Benfica can keep suitors at bay with high release causes, but €20m will be a bargain for a 21-year-old with lots of potential."

With Amorim's budget said to be a little more limited to the transfer warchest afforded to Erik ten Hag last summer, a move for Fernandez would be an affordable option to solve a problem area. Given he knows the club, and Amorim will be well aware of his qualities having managed Benfica's city rivals Sporting CP, it would be a move that would suit all parties on paper.

"On paper he is a good fit, along with doing very well covering the left flank and combining well with his teammates," Fumacas added. "He has also played as a third centre-half at Benfica during some tactical variations by Lage.

"He likes to associate with the midfield in the build-up process, and does very well in short combinations, and getting into the final third - reminiscent of Alejandro Grimaldo, but with more of a defensive ability to his game.

"I feel Carreras is doing well at Benfica because of the trust Lage has put in him, and because he has been able to win the hearts of the fans with his performances.

"Playing at Old Trafford, where he didn't have the best of times, endured rejection, albeit normal for the process of a young player, may be something that will weigh on his psyche, but we are also talking about a 21 year old Carreras who has evolved mentally with the experiences he's had."

article_metadata.headline: Antony might have Manchester United lifeline after 'annoyed' comment
article_metadata.article_text:
Antony has been an awful signing for Man Utd but might have one last chance to save his career at Old Trafford.

The majority of fans believe Manchester United should cut their losses on Antony. The winger's time in Manchester since he signed from Ajax in a deal worth £86million has been disastrous and he looks destined to be remembered as one of the worst signings in the club's history.

“Antony is one of the most exciting young talents in European football and has exactly the right profile for the attacking, dynamic team that Erik ten Hag is building," said former football director John Murtough when he was signed. That statement is 25 months old but hasn't aged well.

It might have been worth double checking Antony's passport to check if he's Brazilian. He doesn't have the flair, creativity or quality that is associated with South America's greatest footballing exports, although the 'Anturny' did cause quite a stir in his first few months at the club. The 'Anturny' skill move wouldn't have been a talking point if he had enjoyed a brilliant first season but he contributed just four goals and two assists in the Premier League.

Although Antony scored in his first three league appearances against Arsenal, Manchester City and Everton, which is remarkable with the benefit of hindsight, he didn't score in the top flight again for six months and it didn't take long for many to conclude he wasn't good enough for United.

But you should always give players the benefit of the doubt and a season to settle. Antony needed to grab the bull by the horns in his second year at Old Trafford and silence the growing doubters but he actually regressed, producing just one goal and one assist in the league.

"I definitely need more goal participations and to score more goals," he told a handful of journalists in a Beverly Hills hotel while on pre-season tour in August. "It's something I demand from myself. Rest assured, you'll hear the name Antony in relation to goals and assists.

"A lot happened last season. I played full back and was a little uneasy about it but that was because with the team losing or drawing you want to be in the attack to turn things around and help the team, so being moved into defence bothered me a bit, you feel annoyed in the moment during the game, but afterwards it's all fine."

The 24-year-old also vowed he would score more goals with his right foot and told reporters he would show them "his notes one day." Antony does not lack self belief - he wouldn't be at United without it - but he's failed to back up his words on the pitch, which is how he's judged.

Antony has started one game this season, against Barnsley in the Carabao Cup when he converted a penalty against League One opposition. He has been given just over 150 minutes in all competitions.

Ten Hag's decision to overlook Amad for Antony when he made a substitution against Fenerbahce in the Europa League was surprising, but he explained he works hard in training. To Antony's credit, he looked bright when coming on but picked up an injury and had to be stretchered off.

Unfortunately for Antony, not much has gone right for him during his time in Manchester - he has dealt with issues away from the pitch - and he's in the last chance saloon at United.

The appointment of Ruben Amorim offers a clean slate but Antony must be sold in the summer window if he's unable to improve between now until the end of the season.

What could spark that improvement? Perhaps he could play as a wing-back. It was fascinating to read him say playing at full-back initially "annoyed" him last season, because adapting and playing in that role in Amorim's system might be the only way to save his United career.

Antony has transferable skills that could make him an effective wing-back but playing him there would be a desperate roll of the dice, with the hope of unlocking some improvement. Whether a position change would work remains to be seen. Antony's time might already be up.

article_metadata.headline: Jamie Carragher says what Ruben Amorim did in first week at Man United should excite supporters
article_metadata.article_text:
Jamie Carragher says the confidence Ruben Amorim has shown in his own ability should breed confidence among Manchester United supporters.

The 39-year-old gave his first interview as the club’s new head boss last week, just days after arriving at Carrington. He underlined his eagerness to instil a sense of identity back into United and the importance of building momentum from the off.

He makes his debut at Ipswich Town on Sunday with United languishing in 13th. Amorim is expected to field his 3-4-3 formation that brought him two Portuguese titles at Sporting CP.

While former Liverpool star Jamie Carragher does “not think this squad is suited to three at the back”, he believes Amorim’s self-assurance will go a long way. "I’ve been really impressed with what the manager has said so far,” he told The Overlap US.

“He certainly has charisma, a personality, he’s laughing and joking with questions. He got asked the question, ‘If I’m a Manchester United fan, what can I see on day one?’

“And more often than not a manager would bat that question away and say, ‘Oh, hang on, I’ve only had two training sessions, we’ve got a long way to go, there’s a lot to change’.

“But he’s just said straightaway, ‘I can guarantee you that you will see a plan, you’ll see an idea in the first two or three games'.

“I’m not a Manchester United fan, obviously, but if I’m a Manchester United fan that would fill me with confidence that he was so confident in his abilities, his system.”

Carragher warned that Amorim faces heftier competition from lower-table teams in the Premier League than he did in Portugal. But he reckons that United will be put in good stead if Amorim is able to get his squad to buy in and then successfully implement his philosophy.

“Let’s not forget, the Premier League has the best managers in the world and he’s coming up against some top operators, not even necessarily at the top end of the table,” Carragher added.

“You look at people like Marco Silva or Thomas Frank, managers of teams in the middle of the table. They’re top managers.

“I admired how confident [Amorim] was and this real belief he seems to have and if he can put that into Manchester United, because there’s still quality players there, and also make them believe in this system and how they go about it, I think he can do well.

article_metadata.headline: Viktor Gyokeres to Man United transfer latest amid Ruben Amorim 'agreement' and Sporting dilemma
article_metadata.article_text:
Ruben Amorim is in his first week of taking Manchester United training following his move from Sporting CP over the international break. The manager takes charge of his first game on Sunday afternoon (4.30pm kick off) when United travel to take on Ipswich Town.

The arrival of Amorim has caused excitement among the United fan base. It has also started speculation over who he could sign in his first transfer window, with the January window fast approaching.

One of the names to be heavily linked is Sporting striker Viktor Gyokeres. The 26-year-old is making waves across Europe with his goalscoring record.

In 18 domestic games across all competitions so far this season, he has scored 23 goals, including a hat trick in the Champions League win over Man City. The striker has also impressed on the international stage for Sweden, scoring nine goals in six Nations League appearances.

Amorim’s move from sporting to United has led to speculation that he could be eyeing a reunion with his former striker. With that in mind, here is the latest on a potential move for Gyokeres, either in January or in the summer.

#### ‘Gentleman’s agreement’

Any potential move for Gyokeres in January could be put on hold, due to a reported ‘gentleman’s agreement’ between Amorim and former club Sporting CP. It is said that the manager has agreed not to approach any of Sporting’s players in the upcoming transfer window.

[Journalist Fabrizio Romano claims](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-man-united-transfer-30418333) that as part of the negotiations that saw Amorim leave the club for United, the agreement was reached. That’s due to Sporting’s hopes of winning their respective title this season, although any summer move for players, including Gyokeres has not been ruled out.

#### What the player has said

Gyokeres himself responded to rumours over his future earlier this week. He gave his thoughts on Amorim’s move to United, before commenting on the links.

"It’s very sad that he’s leaving, but of course we understand his decision," he said. "He has of course meant a lot [to me] considering that he gave me that chance and that he made me develop so much."

Gyokeres then added: "He [Amorim] probably has some strikers there already, so we’ll see. No, he hasn’t [contacted me]. It's fun but nothing I attach any importance to because it’s talk and nothing concrete."

#### Sporting ‘need to sell’

Former Portuguese international Jose Fonte has provided hope to United over completing a deal, by highlighting the financial disparity between the two clubs. "Portuguese clubs have got no option but to sell for the right price," he said.

"We need to sell. Portuguese clubs have to sell one or two players every season.

"We don't have the same TV rights as the Premier League so we don't have the capacity to hold on to players. It would be lovely to see Portugal with a little bit more capacity to hold on to their talent, of course."

#### United monitoring the striker

United Scouts were reportedly in attendance to watch Gyokeres in Sweden’s 2-1 victory over Sloviakia at the weekend. The striker, of course, was on the scoresheet, finding the back of the net after just three minutes to give his side the lead.

Scouts would have also been impressed with his performance in Sweden’s next game. The striker scored four times in his nation’s 6-0 win over Azerbaijan on Tuesday night.

article_metadata.headline: Gary Neville and Roy Keane disagree on Marcus Rashford decision ahead of Ruben Amorim Man United call
article_metadata.article_text:
Gary Neville has called out Casemiro and Marcus Rashford for deciding to jet-off to the USA during November's international break, but his ex-Manchester United teammate didn't agree.
Roy Keane did not take the same stance as ex-teammate Gary Neville.

Gary Neville says it was "not right" for Casemiro and Marcus Rashford to travel to the United States during the international break, given the poor season Manchester United are having, and suggests it might not have been what Ruben Amorim would have wanted.

Neither was called up for their respective countries this month and so decided to travel to Portland to watch an NBA game. Neville has questioned the decision given the toll the long flights and time difference might have had on both players ahead of Amorim's first week at United.

Both were seen in high spirits during the new head coach's first training session at Carrington on Monday - ahead of Sunday's trip to Ipswich Town - but Neville is unsure that they have prepared themselves in the best way given the current context at United.

"I'd ask the question, would my manager want to see me there, would the fans at this moment in time?" Neville mused. Former United skipper Roy Keane did not see much issue in their travels, though.

He said: "They would have had the international break sorted a couple of weeks ago. I wouldn't be a big fan of it, but I would have thought there was bigger stuff to worry about.

"Don't get me wrong, if they're training in the week and they're looking a bit sluggish... We saw pictures with the new manager coming in smiling, all happy, good PR!"

Neville went on: "The professionalism, looking after your body and making sure you're best prepared for the next training session is critical to every decision you make during the season.

"He [Rashford] has got a mental break - he's got to get away and has got to rest with friends - then you talk about the choice of venue, how far do you fly, what's the time difference, is that going to give a jet lag issue, is that going to give a stiffness issue from being on a flight for 12 hours?

"This is on Casemiro more than Rashford, but if I'm 30-years-old and I'm looking after my body - and he's won five Champions Leagues and is an unbelievable player - but if he was away with Brazil for 10 days, then we would say he could struggle this weekend because he's been away.

"They have chosen that international break, almost. If you are talking about minor details - in being as professional as you can be and as prepared as you can be for a training session on a Monday night - that isn't the best choice of venue."

Neville reckons that he's not overly irked by Casemiro and Rashford's trip, but does not believe either would have had copious amounts of rest time ahead of their return to training. He questioned whether the decision emanated acute "professionalism".

Neville continued: "I'm not that wound up about Rashford and Casemiro going over to the United States, but what I'm asking is; If you've got a four-day break, Portland is a 12-hour flight and an eight-hour time difference...

"Your jet-lag is bad, and you feel a bit [rough].

"They went to Portland and I'm asking the question based on professionalism - you're playing badly, the team are losing, you're 13th in the league, and there is a new manager coming in - would you choose that trip as a break to recharge your batteries? That's not a recharging trip. It's not right, that.

article_metadata.headline: Ruben Amorim could sell five Manchester United players to fund January transfer window
article_metadata.article_text:
Ruben Amorim could sell five Manchester United players to fund January transfer window - Amie Wilson - Manchester Evening News
===============

Ruben Amorim could sell five Manchester United players to fund January transfer window
======================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as the new head coach could potentially boost his January transfer budget with sales in his first transfer window with the club.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Antony is one of the players who could potentially be sold by Manchester United in the January transfer window. (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Ruben Amorim doesn’t have long to get his feet under the table at Manchester United before the chaos of a transfer window is upon us.

The new head coach started working with his players on the training pitch this week as preparations for the weekend’s clash against Ipswich start. The time in training will give Amorim a chance to assess his squad, with decisions to be made ahead of the transfer window that opens in less than two months.

Any new boss is likely to be keen to bring in his own players when they have the chance. However, according to the Telegraph, worries over Profitability and Sustainability rules (PSRs), as well as the club wanting to implement a more sustainable structure, means that the transfer budget in January is to be ‘modest.’

**READ MORE: I rejected a move to Manchester United - it would not have made me happy**

**READ MORE: Man United star Antony got told 'behaving like an idiot' ruined Liverpool transfer hopes**

However, one way of boosting the budget will be to sell players. With that in mind, here is a look at five players who United could cash in on in the winter window.

#### Harry Maguire

The defender arrived for £80 million in the summer of 2019 but has found himself down the pecking order for the last couple of seasons. Maguire has been linked with a move away from Old Trafford over the last few transfer windows, with United even said to have agreed a £30 million fee with West Ham in the summer of 2023 with a move never materialising.

Maguire will be entering the final six months of his contract when the January transfer window opens, it means, unless he signs a new deal, it will be United’s last chance to get some money back for the defender.

While they may not get the £30 million agreed with West Ham 18 months ago, any fee would provide a boost to the transfer window funds.

#### Victor Lindelof

Lindelof is in a similar situation to Maguire in that he will be entering the final six months of his contract when the January window opens. The Sweden international is also down the pecking order and has been linked with a move away.

However, Amorim will have to make a decision over potentially losing two centre-backs in the same window. While getting money for them will provide a potential financial boost, it will leave Matthijs de Ligt, Leny Yoro, Lisandro Martinex and Jonny Evans as the centre-backs left in the squad.

#### Christian Eriksen

Another player who will have just six months remaining on his deal in January. He was made available in the most recent transfer window, but decided to stay at Old Trafford for the final year of his contract.

Speaking about his future while on international duty, the Dane said: "I haven't focused on it yet, and I haven't heard anything from the club. Right now it's just about football, and then we have to see where we stand in January and for that matter in the summer."

#### Marcus Rashford

Rashford has struggled for form this season, and is one player who could bring in decent money to fund January incomings. As an academy graduate he would also represent pure profit, which would be a boost in terms of the Premier League’s PSRs.

With questions also over where he would fit into Amorim’s system, a move could benefit all parties. It would provide a fresh start for Rashford and a financial boost to United.

#### Antony

The winger has struggled to make an impact since his £82 million move from Ajax in the summer of 2022. It is reported that United have already made the decision to cash in when the January window opens.

While they will struggle to get anywhere near the transfer fee that they paid just two-and-a-half years ago, a sale could add to the funds available for Amorim. Finding a buyer willing to complete a permanent deal, as opposed to a loan, could however be a challenge.

article_metadata.headline: Man United icon Ruud van Nistelrooy should have replaced Sir Alex Ferguson's saviour
article_metadata.article_text:
Manchester United legend Ruud van Nistelrooy (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)
Few figures who have left the Manchester United dugout since Sir Alex Ferguson's retirement have been serenaded by the Stretford End in their last game.
Even ever-popular Ole Gunnar Solskjaer witnessed a toxic end to his tenure at Vicarage Road albeit he has managed to redeem himself with the fanbase. And yet, Ruud van Nistelrooy managed it as his time at Old Trafford came to an end before the international break with a comfortable victory over Leicester City.
The next day, the Dutchman left United for good as Ruben Amorim welcomed his own backroom staff to the club. While it was disappointing to see Van Nistelrooy leave, it is clear that he deserved more than an advisory role at United should he have stayed for the Amorim premiership and thus he jumped quickly into the process of finding a new job.
Perhaps the biggest currently available job in the United Kingdom is in the Midlands where Coventry City controversially parted ways with Mark Robins at the beginning of the month. Robins once scored the goal that arguably saved Ferguson's career at Old Trafford and it would have been fitting to see one ex-United striker be replaced by another.
However, it is not just sentimentality that points us to this solution. Van Nistelrooy came to United in the summer after an impressive managerial stint at PSV Eindhoven and it is clear the Reds' disheartened squad responded to the Dutchman's tactics during his brief interim role.
But despite this, it looks almost certain that Coventry will overlook him in favour of Frank Lampard. The former Chelsea man enjoyed a good spell at Derby County as a manager but that is five years ago now.
Since then, he has returned to Stamford Bridge twice for two poor spells and was mediocre at best with Everton albeit he did help them to survive in the Premier League. From a Sky Blues perspective it is an underwhelming appointment should it be confirmed.
With a trio of bad tenures under his belt, Lampard represents a huge risk for the Coventry boardroom particularly if, as their supporters fear, he has been brought in because he is a big name. Van Nistelrooy could have also provided that while also giving fans a coach who is coming in on a high.
Coventry seems to have committed yet another error in what has been a bad month for the club and their ownership could live to regret overlooking Van Nistelrooy.

article_metadata.headline: Pep Guardiola has already said what he'll do if Man City are found guilty of 115 charges as new contract is confirmed
article_metadata.article_text:
**Pep Guardiola has signed a new deal with Manchester City, having already confirmed exactly what he will do if the Premier League are found guilty of the 115 charges.**

On Thursday night, [City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) confirmed that the Catalan manager had penned a new two-year deal with the club, extending his stay until 2027.

Having joined the Manchester club in in July 2016, [Guardiola's](https://www.sportbible.com/pep-guardiola) new deal will keep him at the Etihad for more than a decade.

And amid the announcement of his extension, the City boss's comments about what he will do if the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) champions are found guilty in the [hearing for their 115 charges have resurfaced.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-city/man-city-115-charges-andy-goldstein-talksport-415052-20241121)

In February last year, City were charged with breaking the Premier League's [financial fair play rules over a nine-year period between 2009 and until 2018.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/man-city-premier-league-661768-20230206)

And speaking after the details of the charges emerged, Guardiola confirmed that he would stay with the club even if City were found guilty and relegated to a lower division.

Speaking in August, Guardiola said: "At the moment we are innocent until it is proved we are guilty I know the people want it. I know, I feel it. I will wait. Wait and see it and after the sentence has been done we will come here and explain it.

"But absolutely I will not consider my future (if) it depends being here or being in League One. Absolutely. There is more chance to stay if we are in League One than if we were in the Champions League."

Therefore, while City fans will undoubtedly be happy by the news that the six-time Premier League winner was staying at the club, it does not provide any further insight into the potential result of the ongoing hearing into the FFP charges.

Pep Guardiola has won a total of 18 trophies with Manchester City. (Image: Getty)

In the club statement announcing the extension, Guardiola said: “Manchester City means so much to me.

“This is my ninth season here; we have experienced so many amazing times together. I have a really special feeling for this football club.

“That is why I am so happy to be staying for another two more seasons.

“Thank you to everyone for continuing to trust and support me, it has always been an honour, a pleasure and a privilege to be here.

“Hopefully now we can add more trophies to the ones we have already won. That will be my focus.”

article_metadata.headline: Fabrizio Romano reveals Ruben Amorim’s top transfer priority and it’s bad news for one Man Utd player
article_metadata.article_text:
**Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has already outlined his plans ahead of the January transfer window, with a left back being the so-called 'priority' position.**

Amorim took charge of his first training session at Carrington on Monday ahead of this weekend's much-anticipated [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) clash against Ipswich Town.

The 39-year-old, who has penned a two-and-a-half year contract at Old Trafford, got to work on implementing his methods as 10 senior first-team players, including [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.sportbible.com/kobbie-mainoo) and Mason Mount, got the chance to impress.

After footage emerged online, we noticed [a handful of details in the training session](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-training-session-luke-shaw-kobbie-mainoo-283978-20241119). Antony played as a right wing-back – a far from familiar role – while [Luke Shaw](https://www.sportbible.com/luke-shaw) was pushed inside as a left centre-back.

Amorim wants his wing-backs to push high as he continues to push the much-favoured 3-4-3 formation.

And with that in mind, transfer expert [**Fabrizio Romano**](https://x.com/fabrizioromano/status/1859508798802575382?s=46&t=uxXCWj4CwoDO3TqegCIzVA) has indicated that United want to sign a new left-back for Amorim’s system in 2025.

"The club is already assessing options with more than three candidates in list," he said on [**X**](https://x.com/FabrizioRomano/status/1859508798802575382), formerly Twitter. "It only remains to be seen whether it’s gonna happen in January or summer window (most likely)."

Romano has already spoken about Amorim's plans ahead of his first game in charge.

“Left back is a priority position," he said on his YouTube channel. "In 2025, Man Utd want to sign an important left-back. Amorim wants a top left-footed player in that position. Let me say clearly today that [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) are working on a new, important left-back or left-wing back. For sure United will do something there.”

Romano went on to name Bournemouth\\s Milos Kerkez and [Bayern Munich](https://www.sportbible.com/bayern-munich)'s Alphonso Davies as two players on United's shortlist, but they will have competition from elsewhere, with Liverpool already showing an interest in Kerkez.

Romano added: “They are monitoring Kerkez, even before Amorim. Liverpool are also monitoring him and Richard Hughes, [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) director, knows him so well from his time at Bournemouth. It’s not only Kerkez or Davies, there are also other names they are monitoring.”

Thoughts on United's options at left wing-back? Do they need to dip their toe in the transfer market? Let us know in the comments.

article_metadata.headline: talkSPORT presenter reveals 'whisper' he's heard about Man City's 115 charges and final verdict
article_metadata.article_text:
**TalkSPORT presenter Andy Goldstein has revealed a 'whisper' he has heard surrounding Manchester City's 115 charges of breaching financial rules.**

City's charges relate largely to [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) rules, although a minority of them relate to [UEFA](https://www.sportbible.com/uefa).

A hearing into the charges is currently being held in private, meaning little information has been released to the public. After beginning in September, it is due to last for 10 weeks.

City 'strenuously' deny all the charges and have said they will robustly defend their position.

Pep Guardiola fires dig at Man City's rivals over 115 charges

Potential punishments for the club if found guilty include heavy fines and even the possibility of relegation from the Premier League, it has been reported. A verdict is not expected to be reached before the end of the 2024/25 season.

Now, talkSPORT presenter Goldstein, who formerly presented [Soccer AM](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/andy-goldstein-soccer-am-tim-lovejoy-sky-sports-465192-20241025) and football coverage for Sky Sports, has revealed a 'whisper' he has heard about the case while live-on-air.

He said: "I've heard a whisper. I've heard they're going to be found not guilty of all of them \[the charges\].

"It's just a whisper, it's unconfirmed. It's some bloke down the pub telling me, that sort of level.

👀 Andy Goldstein on Man City's 115 charges.. 🗣️ "I've heard a whisper... I've heard they are going to be found NOT GUILTY on ALL of them (115 charges)"... 😱 #[#PL](https://twitter.com/hashtag/PL) [#ManCity](https://twitter.com/hashtag/ManCity)

"Listen, it's just a whisper. I was the first person to say Declan Rice is going to Arsenal. There's footage of me saying that from around a year before it happened, from a reliable source."

Co-host Darren Bent did joke that the 'reliable source' was perhaps more reliable than Goldstein's City 'whisper'.

_SPORTbible has contacted the Premier League for comment._

What are the 115 charges against Manchester City?
-------------------------------------------------

Man City players celebrate winning the Premier League in 2014 (Image: Getty)

Below, in full, are the 115 charges levelled against Manchester City by the Premier League and UEFA.

*   **Failure to provide accurate and up-to-date financial information from 2009/10 to and including 2017/18 -** 54 alleged breaches
*   **Failure to co-operate with Premier League investigations from December 2018-present \[February 2023\] -** 35 alleged breaches
*   **Failure to provide accurate financial reports for player and manager compensation from 2009/10 to and including 2017/18 -** 14 alleged breaches
*   **Breaches of Premier League profitability and sustainability regulations from 2015/16 to and including 2017/18 -** Seven alleged breaches
*   **Failure to comply with UEFA's regulations, including UEFA's Club Licensing and Financial Fair Play regulations -** Five alleged breaches

**Manchester City are ready to offer Erling Haaland a so-called 'mega' deal that would make him the highest paid player in Premier League history.**

The 24-year-old striker, who has scored 105 goals in 114 games for City, including 16 this season, is currently in talks with the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) champions over a new big-money contract worth £500,000 per-week.

That's according to [**The Mirror**](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/erling-haaland-contract-manchester-city-34124235), who suggest that his 'basic salary' would eclipse the Premier League's second-highest paid player, [Kevin De Bruyne](https://www.sportbible.com/kevin-de-bruyne), who is currently on £400,000 per-week.

Haaland has yet to put pen-to-paper as an 'issue' around his £150 million release clause continues to be a stumbling block, but there has been a positive response to recent negotiations.

Manchester City, meanwhile, are hoping that [Pep Guardiola](https://www.sportbible.com/pep-guardiola)'s decision to sign a one-year contract extension will help get Haaland's reported £100 million deal over the line.

Erling Haaland's gesture after Man City's Champions League elimination

Last week, before Guardiola penned his contract extension, Haaland said: “I hope Pep signs a new contract. He has been important for me in the first two-and-a-half years."

He added: “I hope he stays longer. I like Pep a lot and hope he likes me, too.”

Earlier this month, it was reported that [Real Madrid would be willing to offer €200 million \[£166 million\]](https://www.sportbible.com/football/la-liga/real-madrid/transfer-news-jude-bellingham-kylian-mbappe-121257-20241103) to bring Manchester City's top scorer to the club.

article_metadata.headline: Man Utd 'make contact' with European giants for first January signing as Ruben Amorim stamps his mark
article_metadata.article_text:
**Manchester United have made 'direct contact' with Paris Saint-Germain over a January loan move for one of the most expensive signings in their history.**

It looks like new manager Ruben Amorim will operate on a modest budget compared to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united), who spent more than £600 million during his two-and-a-half year spell at Old Trafford..

Earlier this week, [it was reported that United are 'unlikely to be particularly active' in the January transfer window](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-premier-league-transfers-795828-20241118) unless an opportunity presents itself. Instead, [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) has been tasked with 'maximising the untapped potential in the squad'.

But it appears an opportunity has indeed presented itself after [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) made contact with [PSG](https://www.sportbible.com/psg) over a January loan move for Randal Kolo Muani.

Kolo Muani, who joined the [Ligue 1](https://www.sportbible.com/ligue-1) side from Eintracht Frankfurt in September last year for £64.2 million plus £12.2 million in add-ons, has struggled to make an impact at the Parc des Princes.

Theo Hernandez stops Randal Kolo Muani from celebrating with France teammates

Credit: adricontreras4/TikTok

0 seconds of 16 secondsVolume 90%

So far this season, the Frenchman has netted just two goals in 12 appearances for Luis Enrique's side, but it appears he has shown enough for United to make a move.

According to [**Alexis Bernard**](https://le10sport.com/auteur/2) of Le10sport, the Reds only recently expressed their interest in Muani.

The report mentions United 'lacking finances' to make a permanent move, so a loan request has instead been submitted for the second half of the 2024/25 campaign.

It adds: "Discussions will continue until the end of the year and the choice will be up to the player to 'continue fighting' or try the English adventure, with a brand new coach ([Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim)) who seems to want to trust him."

Kolo Muani has struggled to hit the ground running at PSG. Image credit: Getty

Speaking in a recent interview with Telefoot, Kolo Muani expressed his desire to stay and fight for his place at PSG.

"No, I've never thought about it," Muani said when asked about a potential departure.

Ruben Amorim mentions Alex Ferguson in press conference

"You have to keep the mentality. It's up to me to keep working so that the coach trusts me. That's part of my story. I've always had to work hard, things have never been easy for me. You can't let up. If you let up, it's over, then you'll go under."

article_metadata.headline: Gary Neville criticises Marcus Rashford for 'unprofessional' thing he did during international break but Roy Keane disagrees
article_metadata.article_text:
Roy Keane disagreed with former Manchester United teammate Gary Neville after he questioned the professionalism of Marcus Rashford and Casemiro over their actions during the international break.

Earlier this week, Rashford made an eight-hour trip to New York to watch the NBA game between New York Knicks and Brooklyn Nets at Madison Square Garden.

The 27-year-old forward, who has scored four goals in all competitions this season, could be seen courtside with friends before meeting Knicks point guard Jalen Brunson.

Casemiro, meanwhile, enjoyed a family holiday to Disney World. "Awesome few days in Orlando with family and friends, will be back soon!!!" he wrote on Instagram. "Thank you, Orlando."

Their trips to the United States were a big talking point on the latest episode of Stick To Football, brought to you by Sky Bet, as Gary Neville raised eyebrows over what happened.

Roy Keane leaves The Overlap panel in stitches with comment to Jill Scott

“The professionalism, looking after your body and making sure you’re best prepared for the next training session is critical to every decision you make during the season," Neville said.

"He [Marcus Rashford] has got a mental break, he’s got to get away and has got to rest with friends - then you talk about the choice of venue, how far do you fly, what’s the time difference, is that going to give a jet lag issue, is that going to give a stiffness issue from being on a flight for 12 hours?

“This is on Casemiro more than Rashford but if I’m 30 years old and I’m looking after my body – and he’s won five Champions Leagues and is an unbelievable player, but if he was away with Brazil for 10 days, we would say he would struggle this weekend because he’s been away.

"They [Casemiro and Marcus Rashford] have chosen that international break. If you are talking about the minor details in being as professional as you can be and as prepared you can be for a training session on a Monday night, that isn’t the best choice of venue.”

Image credit: Instagram/marcusrashford

Roy Keane, however, defended Rashford and Casemiro over their actions.

He said: “For [Marcus] Rashford and all these lads, going to the United States and going on private jets, whatever they are doing – like basketball, that’s the norm for them. We’re sitting there and going, ‘all the way to the States?’ They [players] would think the States is no big deal.

"We might consider the long flights and the jet lag, but that is their norm. If they were sitting here, they would say, ‘What are you talking about? This is my life and it’s what I do.'"

Ian Wright also gave his take on whether he would have travelled to the US during an international break.

“If it’s my time off then yes, I’d do it," he said. "Simply, because it’s my time off. If you’re going for three or four days, that jetlag won’t cause you too much of a problem.”

Image credit: Instagram/casemiro

He added: “Casemiro and Marcus Rashford are taking a chance that this [travelling 12 hours to the United States for four days] is going to be criticised if they don’t play well - they are accepting what’s to come. It puts you under pressure but then suddenly you can see how quickly it will change.

Roy Keane, Gary Neville and Ian Wright react to Jude Bellingham's goal

"If he [Rashford] doesn’t do well in his first game, and in the next two or three games he scores - nobody cares.

article_metadata.headline: Premier League star's entourage 'convinced' Man Utd will try and sign him as 'excellent' relationship with Ruben Amorim revealed
article_metadata.article_text:
**Manchester United are said to be 'interested' in a player who has an 'excellent' relationship with newly-appointed manager Ruben Amorim, according to reports in Spain.**

Amorim, who will take charge of his first United game on Sunday against Ipswich Town, will operate on a more modest budget compared to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.sportbible.com/erik-ten-hag), who spent more than £600 million during his two-and-a-half year tenure.

In fact, [United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) are 'unlikely to be particularly active' in the January transfer window unless an opportunity presents itself, according to the [**Telegraph**](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/18/ruben-amorim-reduced-budget-man-utd-end-transfer-churn/), who claim [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) has been tasked with 'maximising the untapped potential in the squad'.

With that being said, a report from Spanish publication [**AS**](https://as.com/futbol/primera/pedro-porro-en-la-mirilla-n/) has named United, Manchester City and Real Madrid as those competing to sign Spurs right-back Pedro Porro.

Porro played under [Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) at Sporting Lisbon, where he notched 12 goals and 20 assists in 98 appearances for the Portuguese club.

It is claimed that 'those close' to the defender are 'convinced' that the arrival of Amorim will imply an attempt to sign him.

The report goes on to mention his 'excellent' relationship with the Portuguese coach, who transformed the landscape at Sporting after taking over in 2020, winning two league titles.

Speaking to [**Expresso**](https://tribuna.expresso.pt/entrevistas-tribuna/2024-04-19-entrevista-a-pedro-porro-em-2021-escondi-uma-lesao-para-participar-no-jogo-do-titulo-pelo-sporting.-queria-ir-a-jogo-sim-ou-sim-520395c4) earlier this year, Porro was full of praise for Amorim.

“He is young, has a lot of ambition, a little bit like [Ange Postecoglou](https://www.sportbible.com/ange-postecoglou) here at [Tottenham](https://www.sportbible.com/spurs)," the Spanish full-back said. "He always wants more and that’s what puts him on the world’s lips and coveted by so many teams in Europe,"

Porro added: “He has a special way of working. He plays eye to eye against any opponent, which is also similar to what we do at Tottenham, there are several similarities. It is known and recognised how Sporting and Tottenham play. There is a clear identity, whether winning 5-0 or losing 5-0.”

Pedro Porro was a regular starter under Amorim at Sporting. Image credit: Getty

Porro has gone from strength to strength in recent years. After impressing on loan at Spurs, the North London club snapped him up for around £40 million in January 2023.

article_metadata.headline: Man Utd could 'hijack' move for Real Madrid's top transfer target in deal that would rock the Premier League
article_metadata.article_text:
**Real Madrid are ‘concerned’ that their pursuit of a Champions League winner could be hijacked by Manchester United.**

[United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) are currently 13th in the Premier League but will be hoping their fortunes improve under new head coach Ruben Amorim.

He will take charge of his game as head coach of the Red Devils when his side faces Ipswich Town at Portman Road on Sunday, 24 November.

As for [Madrid](https://www.sportbible.com/real-madrid), they have started the season in poor form by their high standards, with Los Blancos currently trailing league leaders [Barcelona](https://www.sportbible.com/barcelona) by six points, having sustained an embarrassing 4-0 loss against the Catalans on October 26.

The 15-time European Champions also sit 18th in the 36-team Champions League group phase, having suffered shock defeats against Lille and AC Milan.

Carlo Ancelotti’s options have been ravaged by injuries in recent months, with key players Dani Carvajal and Eder Miltao both sustaining anterior cruciate ligament injuries, which will keep them out for the foreseeable future. David Alaba is also nursing a long-term injury.

Both clubs may look to bolster their squad in upcoming transfer windows with Bayern Munich full-back Alphonso Davies, 24.

The Premier League club have ‘already made informal enquiries’ with Davies possibly open to leaving Bayern ‘as a free agent’ next summer, according to Sky Germany’s [Florian Plettenberg](https://x.com/Plettigoal/status/1849845778698662137).

From Davies’ perspective, having two of the world’s biggest clubs reportedly keen on him is an achievement.

The left-back has played nine Bundesliga games since Vincent Kompany took charge of the Bavarians but could look to move on when his current Bayern contract expires this summer.

If he were to move to United, he would provide competition for first-choice Luke Shaw as well as [Tyrell Malacia](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-tyrell-malacia-premier-league-fa-cup-787613-20241115), who is still returning to fitness after a prolonged period out.

If Madrid was his chosen destination, Davies would be competing for a starting spot against Carlo Ancelotti’s preferred starting left-back, Ferland Mendy, as well as backup option Fran Garcia.

Davies' agent recently issued an update on his client’s situation, according to [Fabrizio Romano.](https://x.com/FabrizioRomano/status/1857503370036081127)

“Done deal with Real Madrid? This is NOT true,” [Nedal Huoseh](https://x.com/FabrizioRomano/status/1857503370036081127) explained on November 15.

“Though the player has many options, we have not agreed terms with any club.

Understandably, many United fans are looking at Amorim as the man who could restore the club to the glory days of the past, the Premier League is a tougher place to thrive than Portugal’s top flight.

Following his 2006 retirement, Keane managed Sunderland to the 2006/07 Championship title - gaining promotion to the top flight .

Traditionally, centre-midfielders wear ‘6,’ ‘8,’ or ‘10’.

However, unusually, he wore the number ‘16’ for most of his time at Old Trafford, and the 53-year-old explained the reasons behind his choice of number.

The group were enjoying a meal together in a traditional Italian restaurant in the country’s capital, Rome.

article_metadata.headline: Jermaine Jenas' wife Ellie Penfold breaks silence on 'incredibly difficult' sexting scandal and BBC sacking
article_metadata.article_text:
**Jermaine Jenas' wife Ellie Penfold has spoken out after her husband was sacked by the BBC following complaints about workplace conduct.**

An official statement from the BBC confirmed that Jenas had been taken off presenting duties for both The One Show and Match of the Day due to alleged inappropriate behaviour.

Jenas later admitted to sending 'inappropriate messages' to two of his BBC colleagues, though clarified that they were not sexual and that he did 'nothing illegal'.

And now, Jenas' wife has finally broken her silence on the scandal and revealed how it has impacted her and her husband.

On Tuesday, Penfold appeared at the launch of her personal care brand Preppy, a specialist range for children and teens, and spoke about the scandal involving her husband.

According to The Sun, Penfold said: “It has been an incredibly hard and difficult time for myself and my family.

“My only focus has been on our children and building my brand Preppy.

“Now I just want to move forward.

“Naturally this has been hard for me but my only concern has been our children and that will not change.”

Despite appearing at the launch without her wedding ring, Penfold added that Jenas was completely supportive of her new businesses and was looking forward to seeing where it could go in the future.

"I have been working on this brand for three years and it is something I am incredibly proud of,” she added.

"Jermaine is excited for the business and what it holds for me in the future.

“He has been supportive of me in this respect and as a working mum.”

When details of the scandal became public in August, Jenas spoke with The Sun about how it had impacted him and his relationship with his wife Ellie.

He said: “I was in shock at the time, there was a lot to process. But I’m the married one, I’m at fault.

“The overriding panic by a mile was that I could lose my family.

“There’s something in me that’s praying there is some level of mercy or understanding of the fact we’re human beings and we all make mistakes, some bigger than others and mine is a big mistake.”

“Ellie is absolutely raging. She’s human.

“When I see her now, she is just making sure the children are okay.

article_metadata.headline: Liverpool fans convinced Trent Alexander-Arnold is leaving after seeing what's just appeared in Madrid
article_metadata.article_text:
**Liverpool fans have made their mind up about Trent Alexander-Arnold's potential move to Real Madrid after seeing what just appeared in the Spanish capital.**

[Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/trent-alexander-arnold), 26, is out of contract at the end of the season and will be able to start talks with foreign clubs from January 1, 2025.

The [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) man has played an integral part in the club's early season success under new boss Arne Slot - the Reds currently sit top of the Premier League and 36-team Champions League group phase.

However, arguably the biggest negative surrounding the club is the contractual situation of Alexander-Arnold, [Mohamed Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/liverpool-arne-slot-premier-league-889266-20241120), and [Virgil van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/virgil-van-dijk) – all three are out of contract at the end of the 2024/25 campaign.

article_metadata.headline: Liverpool 'planning shock move for £50m Premier League star' as swap deal planned
article_metadata.article_text:
**Liverpool are ‘planning’ a move for an in-form Premier League forward – but they may have to compete with a rival to sign the player.**

Liverpool have started the season in excellent fashion, with new manager Arne Slot seeing his side pick up 15 wins in his first 17 games in charge of the Reds.

The Merseyside-based side also sit top of both the Premier League and the 36-team Champions League group phase.

However, one of the first challenges faced by Slot when he arrived was the lack of new players coming into the club during the summer transfer window.

Just Federico Chiesa and Giorgi Mamardashvili were recruited, with the Georgian ‘keeper instantly loaned back to Valencia until the end of the 2024/25 campaign.

The Reds tried and failed to sign Real Sociedad ‘number six’ Martin Zubimendi, but so far, Ryan Gravenberch has performed well in the role.

Despite most things currently being positive at the club, the only real negatives are the contractual situations Mohamed Salah, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Virgil van Dijk find themselves in – all three are out of contract at the end of the season.

However, the club are now ‘weighing’ up a move for the Egyptian's potential replacement, according to The Sun.

Liverpool are thought to be keen on Brentford’s Bryan Mbeumo, 25, who has been in impressive form, having already netted eight goals in 11 appearances for the Bees this term.

Mbeumo is most comfortable playing as a right forward/winger, which happens to be the position Salah takes up in the Liverpool side.

But Slot’s side may be in for some tough competition to sign the player as Newcastle United have been ‘watching’ the player, who is said to be highly regarded by Magpies’ boss Eddie Howe.

The report suggests the Tynesiders may be willing to offer Callum Wilson as part of a potential £50m deal, but it is still unclear if talks are underway between either of the clubs.

What has Bryan Mbeumo said about a potential transfer?
------------------------------------------------------

Back in May 2024, the France-born Cameroon international admitted he would like to play at the “best clubs”.

“I have spent five years at Brentford, at a club that has allowed me to grow and pass a milestone, but yes, I would like to play in the biggest competitions, at the best clubs," he said in an interview with L’Equipe.

"It is tantalising to see some big clubs interested in me. We will see [about a transfer]."

The 25-year-old’s current Brentford contract is set to run until June 2026.

article_metadata.headline: Man Utd manager Ruben Amorim reveals big regret that wife 'throws in his face' every day
article_metadata.article_text:
**Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has opened up on the regret that his wife "throws in my face every day".**

The 39-year-old, who will take charge of his first United game on Sunday as the Reds come up against Ipswich Town, has enjoyed a remarkable rise since taking over at third-tier Portuguese sider Casa Pia in 2018.

He went on to impress at Braga, the club he spent a year at during his playing career, before [Sporting](https://www.sportbible.com/sporting-lisbon) triggered the €10 million (£8.3m) clause in his contract. The rest, as they say, is history.

But one big regret from his journey came before [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) made his professional debut for Primeira Liga side Belenenses in 2003.

Speaking in an interview with Portuguese newspaper [**Expresso**](https://tribuna.expresso.pt/), Amorim revealed that he still gets teased by his wife, Maria Joao Diogo, for leaving school before taking his exams at the age 18.

In short, Amorim regrets not having a better education after being unable to complete his school exams.

“I had an agreement with my mother. I would continue at school until I signed a professional contract," he said.

"I signed when I was 17. Today, I regret it a lot. If I’d taken my exams, I could have done the 12th year. I could also have entered a top college. My wife is an electrotechnical engineer and she throws that in my face every day.”

Maria, who tied the knot with Amorim at the Palacio de S. Marcos church in Coimbra, holds a degree in telecommunications engineering and now runs her own interior design business.

In fact, she runs the business called Dois Ton with Raquel; the wife of [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/man-city) director of football Hugo Viana.

The Athletic's Charlotte Harpur recently spent a week speaking to Amorim's family and friends to gain an insight into the new [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) manager.

"It's his charisma, it's his smile," Harpur told [**talkSPORT**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4XHDavi8KD0)."It's very easy to say, but when you interact with him, just from a media perspective, it's fresh and it is different, especially in contrast to Erik ten Hag.

Tyson Fury training footage concerns boxing fans

"I think you can always get a bit carried away. They say it's the hope that kills you, but from the impression that I've had, speaking to his family and to his friends, even in his recent and quite short experience as a coach, they feel he is different and can offer a fresh look. It's hard to express, they said.

"He's going to provide Manchester United, hopefully, with a clean page and a new perspective."

**Media in Uruguay have spoken out about Darwin Nunez after the Liverpool star was taken off early during the international match against Brazil.**

On Tuesday, [Brazil](https://www.sportbible.com/brazil) and [Uruguay](https://www.sportbible.com/uruguay) faced off in a qualifying match for the [2026 World Cup](https://www.sportbible.com/football-world-cup) in Salvador, Brazil.

The match ended as a 1-1 draw with goals from Uruguayan [Real Madrid](https://www.sportbible.com/real-madrid) midfielder [Federico Valverde](https://www.sportbible.com/federico-valverde) and Brazil's Gerson.

[Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) striker [Nunez](https://www.sportbible.com/darwin-nunez) started the match for the visitors but was taken off over half-time, and now Uruguayan media have revealed exactly why.

Darwin Nunez Gives Hilarious Answer To Messi or Ronaldo

The Liverpool star didn't name either player. Credit: @Mosalahh7

After a goalless first half, Uruguay manager [Marcelo Bielsa](https://www.sportbible.com/marcelo-bielsa) decided to replace Nunez with Rodrigo Aguirre as he had been ineffective in the match up until the break.

Uruguayan media later confirmed that the substitution had been a tactical decision and that the 25-year-old had not suffered an injury early in the game.

Local outlet [El Observador](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/seleccion/el-uno-uno-del-primer-tiempo-uruguay-vs-brasil-mathias-olivera-banco-el-fondo-y-facundo-pellistri-animo-el-ataque-n5970992) rated the striker's performance as a five out of ten, praising his defensive working while noting that he did not have a single shot on goal, in part due to a lack of service from his teammates.

Uruguayan newspaper [El Pais](https://www.elpais.com.uy/ovacion/futbol/el-1x1-de-uruguay-contra-brasil-por-eliminatorias-la-lucidez-de-bentancur-y-el-temple-defensivo-de-olivera) also handed Nunez the same rating for his performance in the match, writing: "Good work with his back to the goal.

"Precise in his first touches. He came off after 45 minutes of the first half."

Liverpool fans will be happy to see that their man up front only played half of the match on Tuesday as it remains likely that he will start for their trip to St Mary's Stadium to face Southampton on Sunday.

After traveling to Southampton, Liverpool will face a tough set of fixtures including back to back home matches against has Real Madrid in the Champions League and Manchester City in the Premier League.

Darwin Nunez started both of Uruguay's matches over the international break. (Image: Getty)

With Diogo Jota still recovering from an injury sustained during the match with Chelsea, it is likely that Nunez will start, or at least feature, in all three of Liverpool's next matches.
